Question: Which one of the following choices is a true benefit to following agile practice
Q_1: Build the product all at once
Q_4: Have any strict change management process

Question: While following agile methodologies which of the following decisions would an manager make during an agile project.
Q_1: Allow stakeholders to request changes at any point
Q_2: Allow the team to prioritize the features
Q_3: Develop features that require less development time first
Q_4: Develop features that require more development time first

Question: Which of the following is fixed on an agile project?
Q_4: Features

Question: In the agile manifesto, we value responding to change over?
Q_4: Following a plan

Question: While conducting an agile project, the agile project manager has implemented a new compute software that will allow this schedule to be auto-calculated. What agile value was not followed?
Q_1: Individuals and interactions over processes and tools
Q_4: Working software over following a plan

Question: When conducting an agile project, what is the primary method by which customers will measr the agile project progress?
Q_3: how much of the software is working
Q_4: how much of the budget is left

Question: What is the primary output of the sprint planning meeting?
Q_4: Product register

Question: After the team has completed prioritizing the features in the product backlog, the project manager has informed them of the following:
Q_1: They should have used a numerical scale
Q_2: They should not have prioritized the features
Q_3: They should have prioritized the features based on value
Q_4: They should have prioritized the features based on costs

Question: Which of the following agile tools help all stakeholders to see the maximum amount of work the team will be doing in each phase of the development cycle?
Q_4: Verbal discussions

Question: Which of the following is an example of servant leadership?
Q_1: Dictating what processes the team should use when resolving problems
Q_2: Holding individual team members accountable for issues
Q_4: Communicating the methods the team should use when developing software

Question: As an agile project manager, you have encountered many issues with the product owner.The product owner has refused to prioritize the product backlog, stating that all items are equally important. After educating the product owner about the value of prioritization, he still refuses. What should the agile project manager do?
Q_1: Continue to educate the product owner
Q_2: Prioritize the product backlog for the product owner
Q_3: Have the team prioritize the product backlog
Q_4: Replace the product owner

Question: After speaking with the outside application testers, the agile project manager has been informed that the application has passed the test and is ready to be installed into production. How should the agile project manager inform the team?
Q_3: Tell them in a conference call
Q_4: Send it to them as a memo

Question: When implementing Kanban development, which of the following should be d
Q_1: Create it using custom software on a large screen
Q_2: Create it on a whiteboard with erasable markers
Q_3: Only have the team create it using software
Q_4: Only have the agile project manager create it using software

Question: The product owner has informed the project manager that all items in the product badd valuable and they should all get done. How should the agile project manager respond?*
Q_1: He should agree with the product owner and try to complete as much of the items as possible
Q_2: He should educate the product owner on the benefits of prioritizing the product backlog
Q_3: He should inform the project team that all items should get done immediately
Q_4: Should prioritize the items himself

Question: Where will the customers have the ability to give feedback on a completed increment of the product?
Q_4: Sprint product meeting

Question: While discussing the benefits of agile with three of the organization's key stakeholders, what would be seen as the main benefit of conducting the project using agile methodology versus traditional methodology?
Q_3: Traditional delivers value at the beginning
Q_4: Agile project requires funding upfront

Question: Which of the following is an XP practice where programmers work together in order to writeone set of codes?
Q_4: Double programming

Question: Which of the following would be considered a waste on a project?
Q_4: Waiting

Question: The product owner has added three new changes to the product backlog. The agile project manager has met with the team, and they have immediately decided how to implement these new changes, although these changes will be implemented three iterations from now. The product owner informs the agile project manager that he is not happy about this. What should the agile project manager do?
Q_1: Ask the team members to implement the change right away
Q_2: Ask the product owner when he would like the changes to be implemented
Q_3: Inform the product owner of the potential risk of each change
Q_4: Tell the team they should not have committed to doing these changes until they were ready to implement them

Question: While building the agile space for a new agile team, which of the following tools should the project manager ensure is available to all of them?
Q_1: A big screen monitor with the latest Kanban software
Q_4: Private offices with virtual meeting software

Question: Who is in charge of managing the work during the iteration?
Q_4: Senior management

Question: The agile manifesto values working software over?
Q_4: Following a plan

Question: The agile manifesto contains how many guiding principles?
Who should determine the work that should be placed in the iteration backlog?
Q_4: Senior management

Question: While a Sprint is currently being done, which of the following should not be performed?
Q_1: Adding work to the product backlog
Q_4: Changing methods of communication with stakeholders

Question: To have an effective daily standup meeting, which of the following should not be done?
Q_2: Try to hold the meeting at the same time everyday
Q_3: Try to hold the meeting at the same place everyday
Q_4: Allow team members to discuss personal issues

Question: Which of the following is the characteristic of a high-performing agile team?
Q_3: A team that uses the latest in communication software
Q_4: A team of extremely knowledgeable programmers

Question: When following XP practices, what is the concept of collective code ownership?
Q_1: The codes are collectively owned by the team and can be improved or amended by anyone
Q_2: The code is owned by a single person
Q_3: The code can only be amended by a single person at a time
Q_4: The code should be collected and amended by a single person

Question: During the daily standup meeting, the team members are required to answer how many questions?
What is critical on an agile project for it to be successful?
Q_4: Having a well-defined project management plan
